text: Maulana Muhiuddin Khan (; April 19, 1935, Pakundia â€“ June 25, 2016, Kishoreganj), known also as Muhiuddin Khan of the Quran, was a Bangladeshi Muslim politician, scholar and author who wrote numerous books on Islam in Bengali and also noted for the famous Bengali translation of the Quran through the Maariful Quran. He was major in Bengali, Urdu, Persian and Arabic. He translated for the first time tafseer Maariful Quran into Bengali. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Bangladeshi Muslims Category:Politicians from Dhaka Division Category:Hanafis
